alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Jemez Mountains; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 19 at 4:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including burn scars in the following areas, in central New Mexico, South Central Mountains. In north central New Mexico, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Jemez Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...From Noon MDT today through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations, especially within and below 2021 and newer burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An upper level disturbance passing through the region, and a backdoor cold front penetrating an unseasonably moist atmosphere, will produce numerous showers and thunderstorms this afternoon. Some thunderstorms will be capable of locally heavy rain at rates approaching three quarters of an inch per hour, except 1 inch per hour in the south central mountains. In addition, moderate to heavy rainfall may cause snowpack on higher peaks to melt rapidly, adding to the runoff from showers and thunderstorms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Jemez Mountains; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
